result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ole Loniger Olson

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 8:49 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CM3 & 22CM5. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights to be filed.  
Defendant filled out new forms before Court today. 
VRCW.

State moves to: 
22CM3 --
Ct.1(Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500))>>DRI.

22CM5 --
Ct.4(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct.5(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct.6(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.
Ct.7(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
22CM5 --
Ct.1(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY.
Ct.2(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY. 
Ct.3(Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation, to run CONCURRENT to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two.  No contact with any of the victims(specific areas), unless approved by agent.  J/S payment of restitution to Limericks in the amount of $2400, and $1455 to the City of Wausau.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Court finds defendant is eligible for expungment once he turns 23 years old if all conditions of probation have been completed and no new violations have occured. 

Adj: 9:01 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea hearing on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 10, 2022 at 10:10 am.

Pre-trial conference on January 31, 2022 at 09:10 am.

Jury Trial on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Includes cases 22CM3 & 22CM5. No contact with victim(s): S.J.J., D.L.T., D.L.G.,  Amaximo Realistate Agency, Jefferson Street Parking Ramp, Community Corner Clubhouse, Limericks & FleetFarm. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
